sen.j: 一条 内経（いちじょう うちつね、正応4年7月17日 (旧暦)（1291年8月12日） - 正中 (日本)2年10月1日_(旧暦)（1325年11月7日））は、鎌倉時代後期の公卿・歌人。
sen.e: Uchitsune ICHIJO (August 12, 1291 - November 7, 1325) was a court noble and waka poet in the latter half of Kamakura period.

sen.j: 父は内大臣一条内実、母は内実の父である一条家経の異母妹（すなわち内実の叔母）。
sen.e: His father was Uchizane ICHIJO, naidaijin (minister of the center), and mother was a younger sister of Uchitsune's father Ietsune ICHIJO by a different mother (i.e., Uchizane's aunt).

sen.e: He was so talented as a waka poet that his works were recorded in Chokusen wakashu (Imperial Anthology of Japanese Poetry) after "Gyokuyo Wakasyu (Jeweled Leaves Collection)" as well as "Bunpo Onhyakushu" and "Shoku Genyoshu", but allegedly somewhat untalented as a statesmen.
